document.heading: Gail Cobb Way Designation Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2021
To symbolically designate, on an emergency basis, due to congressional review, the 300 block of 14th Place, N.E., in Ward 6, as Gail Cobb Way.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Gail Cobb Way Designation Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2021".

section.text: Pursuant to sections 401, 403a, and 423 of the Street and Alley Closing and Acquisition Procedures Act of 1982, effective March 10, 1983 (D.C. Law 4-201; D.C. Official Code §§ 9-204.01, 9-204.03a, and 9-204.23), the Council symbolically designates the 300 block of 14th Place, N.E., in Ward 6, as "Gail Cobb Way".

codify:emergency.action: designation of the 300 block of 14th Place, N.E., in Ward 6, as "Gail Cobb Way"

section.heading: Transmittal.
section.text: The Council shall transmit a copy of this act, upon its effective date, to the Mayor and the District Department of Transportation.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
